_of_missing_data_domestic_financing.description: Percentage of missing data among the following indicators: Public expenditure on education as % of GDP, Public expenditure on education as % of total government expenditure and Educational expenditure in primary as % of total educational expenditure.
_of_missing_data_domestic_financing.name: % of missing data, domestic financing (%)

_of_missing_data_outcome_indicators.description: Percentage of missing data among the following indicators: Gross Enrollment Rate in Preprimary, Primary Gross Intake Rate, Primary Gross Enrollment Ratio, Primary Completion Rate and Lower Secondary Completion Rate.
_of_missing_data_outcome_indicators.name: % of missing data outcome indicators (%)

_of_missing_data_service_delivery.description: Percentage of missing data among the following indicators: % of teacher trained (in primary and lower secondary) and Pupil Teacher Ratio (in primary and lower secondary).
_of_missing_data_service_delivery.name: % of missing data, service delivery (%)

aid_committed_for_basic_education_as__of.description: Sum of the Official Development Assistance committed to the support of activities in the basic education sector of development partner countries, as reported by donors and expressed as a percentage of Gross Domestic Product. Basic education aid includes flows directed to: primary education, basic life skills for youth and adults and early childhood education.

gpe_funding_approval_as__of_gdp.description: Amount of Global Partnership for Education funding approved per year expressed as a percentage of Grosss Domestic Product. It only includes Program Implementation Grants. These grants provide funding for three-year programs that support the implementation of an Education Sector Plan, and represent the majority of GPE funding.
gpe_funding_approval_as__of_gdp.display: {{ GPE Funding Approval as % of GDP }}%
gpe_funding_approval_as__of_gdp.name: GPE Funding Approval as % of GDP

gpe_funding_disbursement__as__of_gdp.description: Amount of Global Partnership for Education funding disbursed per year. It only includes Program Implementation Grants expressed as a percentage of Grosss Domestic Product. These grants provide funding for three-year programs that support the implementation of an Education Sector Plan, and represent the majority of GPE funding.
gpe_funding_disbursement__as__of_gdp.display: {{ GPE Funding Disbursement  as % of GDP }}%
gpe_funding_disbursement__as__of_gdp.name: GPE Funding Disbursement  as % of GDP

gpe_funding_disbursement__as__of_gdp.tooltip: {{ GPE Funding Disbursement  as % of GDP }}%

jsr_report_available.description: This indicator monitors whether a JSR report was made available to the GPE Secretariat. An aide-memoire gathers conclusions reached by stakeholders and is produced at the end of the JSR. The Local Education Groups voluntary share their JSR aide-memoires after annual JSRs are undertaken.
jsr_report_available.name: JSR report available

jsrs_conducted.description: This indicator monitors whether the annual process of a Joint Sector Reviews (JSRs) is undertaken or not. A JSR is a monitoring and review mechanism where Local Education Group members get together to assess progress, challenges and funding of the education sector. JSRs provide an opportunity to measure progress against Education Sector Plans, as well as to influence allocations and work-plans. In general, they take place annually or biannually.
jsrs_conducted.name: JSRs conducted

lower_secondary_completion_rate_female.description: Total number of new entrants in the last grade of lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population at the official entrance age to the last grade of lower secondary. This indicator, known as Gross Intake Rate to the Last Grade, is a proxy measure of the completion rate.
lower_secondary_completion_rate_female.name: Lower Secondary Completion Rate Female (%)

lower_secondary_completion_rate_gpi.description: Total number of new entrants in the last grade of lower secondary education, regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population at the official entrance age to the last grade of lower secondary. This indicator, known as Gross Intake Rate to the Last Grade, is a proxy measure of the completion rate.
lower_secondary_completion_rate_gpi.name: Lower Secondary Completion Rate GPI

youth__literacy_rate__female.description: Proportion of the population aged 15 to 24 years old who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement on his/her everyday life. Generally, ‘literacy’ also encompasses ‘numeracy’, the ability to make simple arithmetic calculations.
